You can now choose as databasetype "Informix 10" on installation

The tar consists of 4 files (in it's correct directory):
An Informix10Dialect (Hibernate) 
An informix10.properties (containing specific properties for informix10)
ConfluenceActionSupport.properties (Added Informix10Dialect)
SupportedDatabases.properties (trivial)

Can you add these files to the confluence product?

fields.description:
In my personal space, I quite often have a 'parent' page with little or no text, which has several 'child' pages which contain my useful content.

In 2.10, this was easy to use, as Confluence shows a list of the child pages below the page content, and as there was little or no page content, this list would be near the top of the page.

In 3.0-m8, now that the Sidebar is showing a lot of new information, this list is being pushed down off the screen, meaning that I have to scroll to get to it.  Even though the page is empty, the sidebar means that a large blank area is shown as the page content. This is the case even when I have the sidebar hidden. See screenshot.

Even though there are simple workarounds in this case, such as using the {children} macro, the point is that a user may find such changes annoying. 

The Sidebar should not affect existing page layouts if possible, and especially not when it is hidden.
fields.summary: User Profile sidebar on Personal Space pages is so large it can push useful content off-screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15114].
  {panel}

When a user has a current status update, it is displayed prominently on the Profile page in a big grey panel.

When the status has been cleared, there is no obvious info provided by the UI to show that this has been done (other than the absence of the panel).

The Profile page should indicate when the User Status is empty. This would be particularly needed in the case where the administrator clears/deletes a user's status. Possibly the UI should also indicate who did it.

The Status Update page should also distinguish between a Status Update which is the current one, and one which is the most recently entered, but is not the current one.
fields.summary: Status Updates: provide feedback to a user after a status has been cleared

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15113].
  {panel}

Currently:

* All statuses have the 'delete' action
* the most recent status has the 'clear' action

From a user POV, it is not obvious what the 'clear' link is for.

I would suggest moving and renaming it to make the distinction. E.g. Having a button or menu item called 'Clear Current Status'
fields.summary: Status Updates: it is not obvious to a user how the 'clear' action is different to the 'delete' action

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15109].
  {panel}

Confluence captures useless exceptions in the logs when a htttp client aborts a download. Client abort is a very common event and should not be logged because there is nothing the server or server administrator can do about it. We have hundreds or thousands of exceptions like this in our logs per day which we'd rather not see. 

It's very common for crawlers to abort large downloads while crawling a site, which I assume is the biggest contributor to the number of these exceptions that we see.

fields.description:
This is a general authentication security hole with Confluence tested in version 2.10.2.

Here is how the attack works:
1.Attacker logs in via the login page and two things happen:
  a.A cookie gets stored on their browser with name=JSESSIONID, value=cookie_val, path=/, domain= whaterver the domain is (perhaps A.B.example.com).
  b.A record gets stored to some database tying the attackers account to cookie_val.
2.The attacker logs out via the logout.action script.
  a.The record on the database tying the attacker's account to cookie_val gets deleted or inactivated.
  b.The cookie on the attacker's browser doesn't get deleted (but even if it did they could restore it since the attacker has complete control over their own browser).
3.The attacker stores a cookie to the victim's browser:
  a.The cookie that is stored has name=JSESSIONID, value=cookie_val, path=/, domain= the most general parent doman (perhaps .example.com) under which Confluence is located (this cookie will be submitted to every page in any subdomain of that parent domain and can be set in any subdomain of that parent domanin).
  b.The most common way that an attacker would store a cookie on a victim's browser is through an XSS hole (http://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS), but other vectors exist such as header injection.
4.The victim clicks on a link that the attacker provides (which stores the cookie on the victim's browser and redirects them to the login page) and then the victim logs in normally.
  a.When the victim logs in, a record gets stored to some database tying the victim's account to cookie_val passed in.
5.The attacker (who has the same cookie as the victim now) goes to dashboard.action and can act as the victim.
fields.summary: Session Fixation attack using JSESSIONID in Confluence

fields.description:
On Apr 03, Michael Masterson [says|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Plugin+Guide?focusedCommentId=182682590#comment-182682590]:

{quote}
I got to this page from the Installed Plugins area on the site I admin by clicki...

I got to this page from the Installed Plugins area on the site I admin by clicking "More about plugins." I was trying to learn more about how plugins work, from a site admin point of view, cause my first try with installing a plugin is giving me an error. But this page seems to be aimed at plugin developers, so I thought I'd mention what explanations seems missing for someone starting with plugins. I hope this is helpful.

Repository vs. installed vs. loaded vs. enabled.
Repository vs. Confluence extensions space.
Basic general outline of steps for installing and using a plugin (browse, choose, install, config, test, whatever, etc.) and where one goes for each.
What to do when an error occurs on first installation (ticket with Confluence? go to developer?...)
Where do the four Categories in the chart come from/what do they mean?
What is meant by each of the Storage locations? (what is database? are those folders on the server? etc.)
{quote}

A reply from Support Engineer:

{quote}
Hello Michael,

Thank you for letting us know your concern. I believe that part of your questions can be answered by this [page|Installing Plugins and Macros] and its children. Meanwhile, I have created a [task|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-15106] for our technical writer to review this issue.

Cheers,
Azwandi
{quote}
fields.summary: Review for Confluence Plugin Guide page

fields.summary: CLONE -System error when adding users to a group if the group name contains certain characters

fields.description: The new version 2 licenses are about 30 characters wider than the old ones, and do not fit into the license forms.  Widening the fields is not a complete solution since this naturally squishes everything else.
fields.summary: Licensing screens need redesign to display and update wider licenses

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15099].
  {panel}

As usage on our wiki grows, so does the number of users who forget their usernames and create duplicate registrations.

Are there any plans or support for adding a "Forgot username" link to the login page, presumably using the user's email address to send the username to the user?

I think this would be incredibly helpful.

Tom
fields.summary: "Forgot Username" link at login

fields.description:
Having a link to an anchor inside an exceprt and including the excerpt in another page will result in the rendered content to link to an achor in the current page (which doesn't exist). 

Ideally the excerpt-include should parse all the links inside the excerpt and replace links to anchor with an absolute link.
fields.summary: excerpt-include doesn't correct links to anchor inside the excerpt
Space Details macro will prevent content from being displayed if it used more than once on a page
Space Details macro width parameter does not work
Boost exact phrase matches in searches
Boost document body heading text in search

fields.description: The content of the database text on the splash screen was recently changed to encourage external databases for production. One more change would be even better. Replace "Standard Installation" with "Evaluation Installation" and rename "Custom Installation" to "Production Installation".
fields.summary: Change verbiage on install splash screen from 'Standard' and 'Custom' to 'Evaluation' and 'Production'

fields.description:
In the Maven configuration, we need to set the "installDir" property like this:

{code:xml}
<plugin>
    <groupId>org.codehaus.cargo</groupId>
    <artifactId>cargo-maven2-plugin</artifactId>
    <executions>
        <execution>
            <!-- ... -->
            <configuration>
                <container>
                    <containerId>tomcat5x</containerId>
                    <zipUrlInstaller>
                        <url>${tomcat5.url}</url>
                        <installDir>${installDir}</installDir>
                    </zipUrlInstaller>
                    <!-- ... -->
                </container>
            </configuration>
        </execution>
    </executions>
</plugin>
{code}

Based on [this example|http://cargo.codehaus.org/Installer], we might want to use {{target/installs/}} to isolate the download of each build.
fields.summary: Cargo container download should not use /tmp/cargo/installs

fields.description:
In SPACE1, create a new page called TestPageTitle, and save it.
While still in SPACE1, create another new page, also called TestPageTitle, but edit the location field and change the space to SPACE2.

On saving, you get the error message:

{noformat}  The title TestPageTitle already exists in space SPACE1.  {noformat}

This is not correct, as the check should be done against SPACE2, and the page should be saved with no problems.
fields.summary: Cannot create a page with a duplicate title, even though the page should be saved to a different space which does not contain the duplicate

fields.description:
We should provide the ability to hide macros (such as the bookmark macro) from the macro browser. 

This should ideally be read from the plugin descriptor.
fields.summary: Ability to exclude macros from the macro browser

fields.description:
Due to CONF-6756  a user can now check/uncheck parts of a page tree in bulk, when choosing what should be included in an export.

This more or less duplicates the functionality of 'Check All | Clear All ' as in most cases, the space content will be arranged under a single node.

Should we remove the 'Check All | Clear All ' links?
fields.summary: When exporting a space the Check All & Clear All links are no longer necessary

fields.description:
This is really simple bug that should have been fixed back in 2.9. I reported it as CONF-12518

The cursor doesn't change to a hand when hovering over the "Add" and "Tools" dropdown or the "View" or "Edit" link menu in IE7. If I was someone who was evaluating Confluence in IE, it would look like poor craftsmanship.  I was able to fix this using the IE developer toolbar and change the css cursor property.
fields.summary: Cursor shows up as text cursor instead of hand when hovering over menus in IE7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15066].
  {panel}

Please make it possible to disable Confluence's hotkeys on a per-user basis in user account preferences.

When entering text in most web browsers on MacOSX (in fact in most applications on MacOSX), the following control-key combinations are already claimed for editing shortcuts:

Ctrl-A (move to beginning of line)
Ctrl-E (move to end of line)
Ctrl-D (kill next character)
Ctrl-K (kill to end of line)
Ctrl-Y (paste killed characters)
Ctrl-P (move to previous line)
Ctrl-N (move to next line)
Ctrl-B (move to previous character)
Ctrl-F (move to next character)
and probably others.

Many users, especially programmers who are used to these key combinations from thousands of hours in Emacs, habitually use these shortcuts to quickly navigate and edit text. The fact that Confluence (and evidently other Atlassian applications, as I just discovered while entering this issue and accidentally typed "Ctrl-B") overrides these fundamental text editing shortcuts with its own makes it extremely painful to compose large amounts of text in the browser.

It is so bad that typically I resort to copying the contents of a Confluence page that I am editing into a text editor, edit the text, and then paste it back into the browser. This is because it is incredibly inconvenient when the cursor jumps to another text field or the page navigates away from what I am editing (in the middle of typing), simply because I am trying to use one of the above standard MacOSX text entry shortcuts.
fields.summary: Allow hotkeys to be disabled in user account preferences

fields.description:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-14431: 
{quote}
Can I suggest we rename the #htmlSafe directive? It's the same as the annotation @htmlSafe but means the opposite.

The annotation means that the method should not be automatically encoded because its safe.

The directive means the velocity template should have the auto encoding enabled to make it html safe.
{quote}

We'll go with Don's suggested name of #autoEncodeHtml().
fields.summary: Change the name of the #htmlSafe directive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15030].
  {panel}

In Confluence 3.0, when a Page Comparison is first displayed, each substantial section of unchanged text is hidden and reduced to an ellipsis *' . . . '*. Each one of these hidden sections acts as a 'toggle', such that:
* Clicking one of these ellipses reveals and expands its hidden text
* Clicking an expanded section of text hides and contracts it back to an ellipsis

However, for Tech Writers and people who wish to browse through the entire page of text (since context can be very important), having to click on each ellipsis of a Page Comparison to reveal the entire content could be potentially irritating.

Hence, it would be great to have an 'Expand All' / 'Collapse All' function on this page, such that:
* Clicking 'Expand All' would expand all hidden text sections on the Page Comparison
* Clicking 'Collapse All' would hide these sections again
fields.summary: Page Comparisons - please add an 'Expand All' / 'Collapse All' function to these pages.

fields.description:
To reproduce the problem :
* log in to confluence
* create a page
* restrict viewing of this page to a group of your user
* save the page
* copy link to the page in word/excel document
* click on the link

Then you got the following error :
{code}You do not have permission to access /pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=ds&title=Nihilist00192. To access this page, please log in as a user with sufficient permissions.{code}

The URL the browser try to open is this one :
{code}http://myserver/xns/login.action?os_destination=%2Fpages%2Fviewpage.action%3FspaceKey%3Dds%26title%3DNihilist00192{code}
and the link in the document is
{code}http://myserver/xns/display/ds/Nihilist00192{code}

The lastest demonstration space has a few bugs on a new installation:
# It uses the excerpt and excerpt-include macros.  These don't completely work on imported data.  Excerpt-include only works on excerpts of pages that have been rendered at some stage, which importing doesn't do.
# It uses the table macro from the compatibility macros plugin, which is disabled by default.
# It uses the blog-posts macro to display a blog-post with a code macro in it, which apperently doesn't work (I suspect due in part to the same root cause as [CONF-14156])

None of these are very serious bugs, but I'd think the space we use to show off the functionality shouldn't be highlighting its flaws.

fields.description:
This probably doesn't affect customers much, but it affects me during development and may happen very occasionally to customers doing an upgrade.

If you have a Web browser open and editing a page, then it sends out draft requests to Confluence periodically.  If this happens while Confluence is being set up, then the following errors occur.

{noformat}
2009-03-25 13:06:21,469 ERROR [http-8080-Processor25] [org.directwebremoting.spring.SpringCreator] error Error
java.lang.InstantiationException: DWR can't find a spring config. See the logs for solutions
	at org.directwebremoting.spring.SpringCreator.getInstance(SpringCreator.java:141)
	at org.directwebremoting.spring.SpringCreator.getType(SpringCreator.java:106)
	at org.directwebremoting.impl.DefaultCreatorManager.addCreator(DefaultCreatorManager.java:118)
	at org.directwebremoting.impl.DefaultCreatorManager.addCreator(DefaultCreatorManager.java:100)
	at org.directwebremoting.impl.DwrXmlConfigurator.loadCreate(DwrXmlConfigurator.java:274)
	at org.directwebremoting.impl.DwrXmlConfigurator.loadAllows(DwrXmlConfigurator.java:224)
	at org.directwebremoting.impl.DwrXmlConfigurator.configure(DwrXmlConfigurator.java:170)
	at org.directwebremoting.impl.ContainerUtil.configureFromDefaultDwrXml(ContainerUtil.java:262)
	at org.directwebremoting.impl.ContainerUtil.configureContainerFully(ContainerUtil.java:419)
	at org.directwebremoting.servlet.DwrServlet.init(DwrServlet.java:79)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapper.loadServlet(StandardWrapper.java:1139)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapper.allocate(StandardWrapper.java:791)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke(StandardWrapperValve.java:127)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContextValve.invoke(StandardContextValve.java:174)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(StandardHostValve.java:127)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve.invoke(ErrorReportValve.java:117)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(StandardEngineValve.java:108)
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:151)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.process(Http11Processor.java:870)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11BaseProtocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.processConnection(Http11BaseProtocol.java:665)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.PoolTcpEndpoint.processSocket(PoolTcpEndpoint.java:528)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.LeaderFollowerWorkerThread.runIt(LeaderFollowerWorkerThread.java:81)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java:685)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:613)
{noformat}

The exception isn't propagated to the top, so the Servlet Container believes that the Servlet has been successfully initialised, so all calls to DWR once Confluence actually is set up (until it's restarted) are broken.

Furthermore, the premature calls to the Spring container made by the DWRServlet's initialisation method can cause various things to break.  Eg I just gave it a try and the Advanced Macros plugin wasn't enabled.

{noformat}
2009-03-25 17:14:48,183 ERROR [http-8080-Processor19] [com.atlassian.plugin.DefaultPluginManager] addPlugins Unable to start the following plugins: confluence.macros.advanced
 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/confluence/setup/setuplicense.action | url: /confluence/setup/setupembeddeddb-default.action | userName: anonymous | action: setupembeddeddb-default
2009-03-25 17:14:51,437 ERROR [http-8080-Processor21] [[Catalina].[localhost].[/confluence].[dwr-invoker]] invoke Servlet.service() for servlet dwr-invoker threw exception
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/springframework/web/servlet/support/RequestContextUtils
	at org.directwebremoting.spring.SpringCreator.getBeanFactory(SpringCreator.java:174)
	at org.directwebremoting.spring.SpringCreator.getInstance(SpringCreator.java:132)
	at org.directwebremoting.spring.SpringCreator.getType(SpringCreator.java:106)
	at org.directwebremoting.dwrp.BaseCallMarshaller.findMethod(BaseCallMarshaller.java:221)
	at org.directwebremoting.dwrp.BaseCallMarshaller.marshallInbound(BaseCallMarshaller.java:127)
	at org.directwebremoting.servlet.PlainCallHandler.handle(PlainCallHandler.java:44)
	at org.directwebremoting.servlet.UrlProcessor.handle(UrlProcessor.java:101)
	at org.directwebremoting.servlet.DwrServlet.doPost(DwrServlet.java:146)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:710)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:803)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:269)
{noformat}

fields.description:
In the last several weeks we've been seeing a lot of confluence instabilities at wikis.sun.com - all of them were related to running out of heap space. Several iterations of increasing Xmx didn't help (we started at 3GB and now we are at 5GB and 64bit JVM).

I took several memory dumps during outages and analyzed them with Eclipse Memory Analyzer, which repeatedly found two issues:
* [SAXParser memory leaks|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-14988]
* hundreds of instances of net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl retaining 750MB+ heap memory

At the same time I see that the dump contains total of 163 threads. Given that Confluence uses OpenSessionInView pattern, I'd expect to see less than 163 live session instances (since not all the threads are j2ee service threads).

I'm attaching some annotated screenshots from Eclipse Memory Analyzer.
fields.summary: Possible net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl Memory Leaks

fields.description:
In the last several weeks we've been seeing a lot of confluence instabilities at wikis.sun.com - all of them were related to running out of heap space. Several iterations of increasing Xmx didn't help (we started at 3GB and now we are at 5GB and 64bit JVM).

I took several memory dumps during outages and analyzed them with Eclipse Memory Analyzer, which repeatedly found two issues:
* Something is storing Xerces SaxParser objects as ThreadLocal variables, this results in up to 90MB being retained per thread and I see several instances of this size being held in memory causing total of 800-1200MB of the memory to be retained
* Hundreds of instances of  net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl retain additional ~780MB of memory - I'll document this as a separate issue

Just before taking the heap dump, I also took a thread dump. By comparing the two I found that threads that were holding on the the huge thread local variables were currently in the containers thread pool and were not processing any requests - thus should have minimal memory requirements.

I'm attaching some annotated screenshots from Eclipse Memory Analyzer and a thread dump that proves that the misbehaving threads were idle.
fields.summary: SAXParser memory leaks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14986].
  {panel}

I understand that Atlassian won't official support beta versions of browsers and I'm not asking for a change to that policy.  However, I am asking that the browser detector treat Safari 4 (beta) no differently than it does for the supported versions of Safari 3.

Current Behavior when User Agent for Safari 4 Beta is left at default:
Rich text editor tab does not appear when editing a page

Current Behavior when using Safari 4 Beta's "Develop->User Agent->Safari 3.2.1 (Mac)" menu option:
Rich text editor tab appears when editing a page and works as expected, just like when using Firefox 3

Expected Behavior when User Agent for Safari 4 Beta is left at default:
Rich text editor tab appears when editing a page and works as expected, just like when using Firefox 3

Please target this resolution of this regression for 2.10.3
fields.summary: Browser detector falsely downgrades functionality offered to Safari 4
Handling of non-viewable spaces is inconsistent and leaks information
